ARIOSTEA’s ELEMENTAE SURFACES INSPIRED BY PORTUGUESE LIMESTONE

Ariostea, part of the Iris Ceramica Group, brings the raw characteristics of Portuguese stone into contemporary architecture with its Elementae full-body porcelain stoneware project. Offering versatile solutions for both residential and commercial spaces, the luxury technical ceramics combine strength with a flawless finish, providing durable architectural surfaces ideal for indoor and outdoor applications. Suitable for floors, walls, and even bespoke elements like worktops and staircases, Elementae elevates the aesthetic of any room while ensuring long-lasting performance.


Ariostea’s Elementae surfaces are inspired by Portuguese stone | all images courtesy of Ariostea

FULL-BODY PORCELAIN STONEWARE SURFACES WITH A STONE EFFECT

Ariostea is a leader in the world of porcelain surfaces, recognized for its high-quality floor and wall coverings. With over three decades of experience, the brand has mastered full-body porcelain technology, ensuring uniformity throughout each tile’s thickness. Ariostea’s forward-thinking approach drives its mission to push the boundaries of design, producing stone-effect full-body porcelain stoneware that elevates modern living spaces to new levels of visual and sensory well-being.


Elementae offers a versatile cladding solution for contemporary architecture

A MODERN AND LUXURIOUS AMBIENCE through ELEMENTAE surfaces

These stone-inspired surfaces are available in four distinctive shades – Aere (White), Labi (Mocha), Pluvia (Grey), and Sabula (Beige) – providing a timeless color palette that integrates effortlessly into any setting. Whether for residential interiors or high-traffic commercial spaces, Elementae creates a luxurious and modern ambiance.

The versatility of the Ariostea Elementae project is reflected in its range of sizes and finishes, offering options such as Natural Plus, Flamed, Structured, and slip-resistant outdoor surfaces. The comprehensive formats, including large-scale 120×120 cm tiles and more compact 60×60 cm variations, cater to the needs of any architectural project. For outdoor spaces, the 20 mm-thick Antislip version ensures safety and durability, making it ideal for terraces, courtyards, and public areas.


the surfaces are suitable for floors, walls, and elements like worktops and staircases
